definitions.usage: 指影响某事或某人的一组事实、条件或环境，通常是客观存在的背景或情境。

examples.scene: 一位学生因为家庭经济困难，无法支付学费，正在与学校商量解决方案。
examples.chineseIdea: 学生想表达由于当前的经济状况，无法继续学业，希望学校能理解。
examples.sentenceWithBlank: Given the financial difficulties, continuing education is challenging @ @ @.
examples.fullEnglishSentence: Given the financial difficulties, continuing education is challenging 「under the circumstances」.
examples.chineseTranslation: 鉴于经济困难，继续学业在「当前情况下」很有挑战性。
examples.chinglishFix: 典型中式英语：'Because my family's situation, I can't study.' 纠正：'Due to my family's financial circumstances, I am unable to continue my studies.'

examples.scene: 一位员工因为公司突然裁员，失去了工作，正在向朋友解释情况。
examples.chineseIdea: 员工想说明由于公司裁员的特殊情况，他暂时无法找到新工作。
examples.sentenceWithBlank: Finding a new job is tough @ @ @.
examples.fullEnglishSentence: Finding a new job is tough 「in these circumstances」.
examples.chineseTranslation: 在「这些情况下」找新工作很困难。
examples.chinglishFix: 典型中式英语：'Because company cut people, I no job.' 纠正：'Due to the company's layoffs, finding a job is difficult under these circumstances.'

definitions.usage: 指特定的事件、事实或某事的具体细节，通常用来描述某件事情的来龙去脉。

examples.scene: 一位律师在法庭上为客户辩护，试图说明客户的行为有特殊原因。
examples.chineseIdea: 律师想表达客户的行为是由于特殊的事件或情况导致的。
examples.sentenceWithBlank: The client's actions were justified due to @ @.
examples.fullEnglishSentence: The client's actions were justified due to 「extenuating circumstances」.
examples.chineseTranslation: 客户的行动由于「特殊情况」而被证明是正当的。
examples.chinglishFix: 典型中式英语：'He do that because some special things.' 纠正：'His actions were due to extenuating circumstances.'

examples.scene: 一家公司因供应链问题取消了产品发布会，向客户发送道歉信。
examples.chineseIdea: 公司想解释由于意外事件，发布会不得不取消。
examples.sentenceWithBlank: The product launch was canceled because of @ @.
examples.fullEnglishSentence: The product launch was canceled because of 「unforeseen circumstances」.
examples.chineseTranslation: 产品发布会因「意外情况」而取消。
examples.chinglishFix: 典型中式英语：'We cancel because some sudden things.' 纠正：'The launch was canceled due to unforeseen circumstances.'
